intro: Microstylis tepicana, commonly known as the slender-styled grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae, and is native to certain regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. Microstylis tepicana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
